    • getEarthShape

      public static EarthShape getEarthShape()
      Retrieve a reference to the EarthShape object that is used to convert between [lat, lon, depth] and [unitVector, radius]
      Returns:

    • setEarthShape

      public static void setEarthShape(EarthShape shape) throws Exception
      Specify the EarthShape that is to be used by the application to convert between [lat, lon, depth] and [unitVector, radius].

      VectorGeo.earthShape defaults to WGS84. Once the value is set by a call to this method or is accessed by a call to VectorGeo.getEarthShape(), it becomes immutable and can never be modified again.

      Parameters:
      shape -
      Throws:
      Exception - if an attempt is made to modify the value of VectorGeo.earthShape after the value was previously set or accessed.

    • setEarthShape

      public static void setEarthShape(Properties properties) throws Exception
      Specify the EarthShape that is to be used by the application to convert between [lat, lon, depth] and [unitVector, radius].

      VectorGeo.earthShape defaults to WGS84. Once the value is set by a call to this method or is accessed by a call to VectorGeo.getEarthShape(), it becomes immutable and can never be modified again.

      The value of property 'earthShape' will be retrieved from the properties object and used to specify the value of VectorGeo.earthShape. Default value is WGS84

      Parameters:
      properties -
      Throws:
      Exception - if an attempt is made to modify the value of VectorGeo.earthShape after the value was previously set or accessed.

    • getVectorDegrees

      public static double[] getVectorDegrees(double lat, double lon)
      Convert geographic lat, lon into a geocentric unit vector. The x-component points toward lat,lon = 0, 0. The y-component points toward lat,lon = 0, 90. The z-component points toward north pole.
      Parameters:
      lat - geographic latitude in degrees.
      lon - longitude in degrees.
      Returns:
      3 component unit vector.

    • getVectorDegrees

      public static void getVectorDegrees(double lat, double lon, double[] vector)
      Convert geographic lat, lon into a geocentric unit vector. The x-component points toward lat,lon = 0, 0. The y-component points toward lat,lon = 0, 90. The z-component points toward north pole.
      Parameters:
      lat - geographic latitude in degrees.
      lon - longitude in degrees.
      vector - 3 component unit vector.

    • getVector

      public static double[] getVector(double lat, double lon)
      Convert geographic lat, lon into a geocentric unit vector. The x-component points toward lat,lon = 0, 0. The y-component points toward lat,lon = 0, PI/2. The z-component points toward north pole.
      Parameters:
      lat - geographic latitude in radians.
      lon - longitude in radians.
      Returns:
      3 component unit vector.

    • getVector

      public static void getVector(double lat, double lon, double[] vector)
      Convert geographic lat, lon into a geocentric unit vector. The x-component points toward lat,lon = 0, 0. The y-component points toward lat,lon = 0, PI/2 The z-component points toward north pole.
      Parameters:
      lat - geographic latitude in radians.
      lon - longitude in radians.
      vector - 3 component unit vector.

    • getEllipse

      public static double[][] getEllipse(double latCenter, double lonCenter, double majax, double minax, double trend, int npoints, boolean inDegrees)
      Compute points that define an ellipse centered at a specified point.
      Parameters:
      latCenter - latitude of center of ellipse
      lonCenter - longiitude of center of ellipse
      majax - the length of the major axis of the ellipse, in km.
      minax - the length of the minor axis of the ellipse, in km.
      trend - the orientation relative to north of the major axis of the ellipse.
      npoints - the number of points to define the ellipse
      inDegrees - if true, centerLat, centerLon, trend and all return values have units of degrees, otherwise, the units are radians.
      Returns:
      an array with dimensions npoints x 2 containing the latitude and longitude of points that define the ellipse.

    • getSquashFactor

      public static double getSquashFactor(double[] v)
      If you have some radius value that is appropriate at the equator, multiply it by squash value in order to get the radius value appropriate at the latitude of the supplied unit vector.
      Parameters:
      v - double[]
      Returns:
      double

    • angle

      public static double angle(double lat1, double lon1, double lat2, double lon2)
      Returns the epicentral distance from lat1,lon1 to lat2,lon2, in radians
      Parameters:
      lat1 - latitude of first point in radians
      lon1 - longitude of first point in radians
      lat2 - latitude of second point in radians
      lon2 - longitude of second point in radians
      Returns:
      epicentral separation in radians

    • angleDegrees

      public static double angleDegrees(double lat1, double lon1, double lat2, double lon2)
      Returns the epicentral distance from lat1,lon1 to lat2,lon2, in degrees
      Parameters:
      lat1 - latitude of first point in degrees
      lon1 - longitude of first point in degrees
      lat2 - latitude of second point in degrees
      lon2 - longitude of second point in degrees
      Returns:
      epicentral separation in degrees

    • azimuth

      public static double azimuth(double lat1, double lon1, double lat2, double lon2)
      Returns the azimuth from lat1,lon1 to lat2,lon2, in radians
      Parameters:
      lat1 - latitude of first point in radians
      lon1 - longitude of first point in radians
      lat2 - latitude of second point in radians
      lon2 - longitude of second point in radians
      Returns:
      azimuth in radians or NaN if invalid.

    • azimuthDegrees

      public static double azimuthDegrees(double lat1, double lon1, double lat2, double lon2)
      Returns the azimuth from lat1,lon1 to lat2,lon2, in degrees
      Parameters:
      lat1 - latitude of first point in degrees
      lon1 - longitude of first point in degrees
      lat2 - latitude of second point in degrees
      lon2 - longitude of second point in degrees
      Returns:
      azimuth in degrees or NaN if invalid.

    • convertLatitude

      public static double convertLatitude(double lat, EarthShape fromEarthShape, EarthShape toEarthShape)
      Convert a latitude in radians from one EarthShape to another. If the two EarthShapes are the same, returns unmodified value.
      Parameters:
      lat - latitude in radians relative to EarthShape fromEarthShape
      fromEarthShape - the current EarthShape
      toEarthShape - the EarthShape of the returned value.
      Returns:
      latitude in radians relative to EarthShape toEarthShape

    • convertLatitudeDegrees

      public static double convertLatitudeDegrees(double lat, EarthShape fromEarthShape, EarthShape toEarthShape)
      Convert a latitude in degrees from one EarthShape to another. If the two EarthShapes are the same, returns unmodified value.
      Parameters:
      lat - latitude in degrees relative to EarthShape fromEarthShape
      fromEarthShape - the current EarthShape
      toEarthShape - the EarthShape of the returned value.
      Returns:
      latitude in degrees relative to EarthShape toEarthShape
